INSTALLED. HE RELENTS AND LETS HER DO IT.

VINCE WELDS IN A ROLL CAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slices through a canyon of tall buildings. Hardly any traffic at this time, just heavy haulers. A gasoline tanker, a car carrier, a flatbed with a huge bulldozer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIG RIG. The Peterbuilt tractor pulls a nondescript whi container with Japanese export seals on its padlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMMING to country music, a TRUCKER rubs weary eyes and checks the clock: 4:00AM. He reaches for a thermos. RAGE AGAINST THE MACHINE BLARES somewhere behind him. Startled, his coffee spills. He peers into his mirror.

dialogues.speaker: BLINDING HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: He squints, lifts an arm for shade. He HEARS a performanc engine ROAR, its turbo SQUEALING. Looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glimpses his own reflection in the glistening hood of black on black Honda Civic built for speed. It takes off the freeway and is gone, just like that.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: More HEADLIGHTS. Blinding. VROOM! VROOM! VROOM! Three more tricked Civics appear like rockets, CRISS-CROSSING in front of the truck. The little black cars cavort playfully around the semis a they zoom up the freeway. Fading in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCKER
dialogues.text: Sucks air through his teeth, unamused by the deadly antic

dialogues.speaker: TRUCKER
dialogues.text: Stupid damn kids. EXT. 110 FREEWAY - NIGHT ° Our Big Rig passes an on-ramp. From which...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUR CIVICS
dialogues.text: Suddenly appear. Their engines, music SCREAMING. They box in the Big Rig as it enters a long tunnel.  Blue Revision 05/05/2000 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trucker watches in disbelief as the sunroof of the le car opens and a BANDIT emerges wearing an odd helmet and mask. He raises a speargun. With a finger, the Trucker stabs the EMERGENCY button on CB radio.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCKER
dialogues.text: I'm being jacked! I-5 North at the 110 interchange! STATIC. There is no signal in the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bandit shoulders the speargun. Aims at the Big Rig. THWACK-DINK! A spear pierces windshield. Barbs extend, anchoring it. The Bandit clips the spear's cable to the rollcage. The Driver punches the gas. The cable pulls taught and the windshield is yanked from its frame. It SHATTERS against the highway. The Bandit unclips the cable from the rollcage. He loads another spear into the gun. THWACK-DUNK! The spear slams into the seat next to the Driver. This time the cable clipped to the arrow leads to... The Bandit, climbing out the sunroof, revealing a cable r on his chest. He rides the Civic like an insane surfer. He pulls the pin of a chemical grenade in his hand. It smokes furiously. The Bandit leaps into space... hits a button -- the winch his chest RATCHETS him to the Big Rig. The Bandit bounces against the grill. INT. BIG RIG (MOVING) - NIGHT ” Trucker watches the Bandit hurl the HISSING canister thro the missing windshield. White smoke fills the cab. The Trucker slumps. The Big Rig SWERVES WILDLY. The trailer whips right... left... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nearly jackknifes. The Bandit climbs across the hood, int the cab. About to smash into the...

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL WALL
dialogues.text: He maneuvers into the driver's seat. He works the wheel a gears with skill. The Big Rig pulls away from the wall, straightens out, accelerates. It exits the tunnel and cut a hard right toward an offramp. The Bandit gives the high sign. The little black cars fal in behind like ducklings. EXT. OFFRAMP — NIGHT The Big Rig moving too fast, outside tires SCREAMING, it threatens to tip, SCRAPING the steel safety rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone LAPD cruiser SCREECHES to a stop at the bottom of ramp. Two COPS get out, aim their 9's up the ramp. The Big Rig's engine HOWLS. Its AIRHORN blows in warning. The Two Cops trade looks, dive out of the way as... Whim The cruiser is smashed backwards into a bus stop shelter with a collision repair advertisement. The Rig barely manages the turn. Followed by the four Civics. : A Cop SCREAMS into his radio. SEES the Civics have no plates. TWO POLICE CRUISERS slide sideways onto the empty road, heavy duty V8's GROWLING. The Civics simultaneously scatter down four different sidestrokes. The two cruisers focus on the Big Rig, a good distance ahead. INT. BIG RIG (MOVING) - NIGHT ° It pulls off San Fernando, down a side street, heading fo the old warehouses along the L.A. River. The Big Rig SMASHES through a metal gate. Headlights hit a warehouse's wall -- finding large wooden doors as the Big Rig swerves. CRASHES through the doors.  10 12 13

dialogues.speaker: 14A
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Big Rig crosses the parking lot, heading for the L.A. River. It flattens a chainlink fence, crosses a service road, and punches through a second chainlink fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Big Rig careens down an embankment. A HELICOPTER arrives and hits it with the Nightsun. The Big Rig rolls down the cement channel, precarious, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The shattered doors are now an ugly pile of wood. The cop car swerves, follows the side of the warehouse. Passes though flattened fence. Now cruising the service road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It runs parallel to the river.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO COP CARS
dialogues.text: Zoom up the road, following the Big Rig in the riverbed below. To their amazement, it heads right for a forest of concrete columns supporting a large bridge. EXT. BRIDGE - NIGHT 13c The Big Rig COLLIDES with a huge unyielding column. The c is crumpled. No one could have survived.

dialogues.speaker: THE, TWO COP CARS
dialogues.text: Come rolling down the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens. The stolen Big Rig emerges. .The door close CRANE through the Big Rig's exhaust into: INT. WAREHOUSE - NIGHT 14a The Trucker is passed out on a pile of scrap cardboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COP approaches the smashed cab, gun drawn. He pulls at the crumbled door. A BODY falls out --- Not a body, a CPR dummy. The Cop peers in the cab, SEES a cinderblock on th gas’ pedal.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER COP
dialogues.text: Shines his light inside the open doors of the shipping container -- It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech beast, its engine GRUMBLES angrily. At the wheel is BRIAN, early 20's, good looking, athletic, a gol boy. He plays his intense eyes over a bank of gauges and readouts. Pure confidence as he flips switches, He presses buttons on the turbo control. The readout BEEP counts down from 10. He opens a door atop the gearshift, exposing a red button. Brian leans forward, expectant.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ten second quarter mile... Orange cones ahead mark the finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty concrete sea. The bright green Supra with Arizon plates is poised to pounce, a massive intercooler replaci the front bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2... 1... Zero. Brian stomps the gas, hits the little red button. The engine SCREAMS. The turbine HOWLS. 1st gear, clutch up. The rear tires spin, smoke. The Supra shimmies a beat, then... . ° VROOM! The car rockets forward. Brian shifts, 2nd gear, struggling for control, fishtailing. 3rd gear. The car hits 9O0MPH. ‘Then, the front end begins to float then... Brian misfits, Gears GRIND. The car spins out, corkscrewing across the parking lot. The world outside rotates a few times. The car stops. The engine BACKFIRES and stalls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 19 20 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 6. CONTINUED: ‘ 18 Frustrated, Brian sighs, sits in silence a beat. This car scares him and that passes him off. He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: »..shit... He starts the car and cautiously pilots it to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A performance racing parts store. Brian's Supra pulls up. He gets out and crosses to the entrance,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a high tech, otherworldly gallery of exotic racing a performance parts; turbos, exhausts, rims. Gleaming gages and winking dash computers. HARRY, the proprietor, a tough older black guy, sits on a stool filling out shipping labels. The cuff of his Dickie has ridden above boot top to reveal a prosthetic leg. He looks up at Brian, gives him an angry stare.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What now? Brian rubs two fingers together -- Money. Harry crosses h arms.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don't like you very much.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't have to like me. You just have to listen to me. Harry grudgingly hits the NO SALE key and gives Brian a twenty from the register.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going over there. What do you want on your Sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They know. Good luck. Brian gives him a look and grabs Harry's keyring off the counter. Harry watches him cross and exit the front door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 208 21 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pick-up with HARRY'S PRO SHOP emblazoned on the door is parked under some shade trees. Brian sits behind the whee with the sports page. He's watching: TORETTO'S LUNCH COUNTER, a small sandwich shop a half blo away. A CUSTOMER exits. A lone FIGURE behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airbrushed race cars and submarine sandwiches on the wall all unbelievably lifelike. MIA TORETTO, Brian's age, slic a beefsteak. tomato with practiced precision. A stunner, looks up with warm eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's pick-up parks and Brian exits.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian enters, crosses to the counter and turns on the cha he seems entirely disingenuous and sincere.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Hi, Harry sent me. He said you know what he likes.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Corned beef on a french roll with extra mustard. Do you know what you like? A beat as Brian checks her out.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Probably isn't on the menu.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Probably not. But our sandwiches are good.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Gimme a sub with everything. Brian hands her the twenty. Looks at photos on the wall a she makes change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of race cars, track scenes, several feature DOUG TORETTO, square jawed racer posing with his race cars. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 8. CONTINUED: ‘ 21 On the adjacent wall, there's a life size painting of Dou helmet underarm, a race winning smile. Brian nods at it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice. Who painted it?

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Me. Brian impressed. Mia beams.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Guess talent runs in your family. Mia looks at Brian. She knows what he's going to say next

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How's a guy get a shot racing Dominic? Mia looks at him, disappointed he's like all the rest. Sh slaps the change in his hand. Mia begins making the order Brian looks at the coffee in Mia's mug. It ripples with vibration. Something is approaching. RUMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND BRIAN
dialogues.text: Four cars streak past the windows. Their turbos WHINE, waste gates HISS. Brian turns in time to see their dust. The NOISE fades.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. When he turns back to Mia, she has a cagey little grin.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Tucson.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Desert dweller. You a 'neck?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No. I'mme. I'm my own thing.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: One of a kind. Working for Harry? Brian nods: yes. Mia feels for him.

dialogues.speaker: MIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bet he's busting your ass. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 21B
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 9.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Been there three days, I hope he's just testing me.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: No, it won't let up. Brian sags with mock weariness. In B.G. Unnoticed to Bria and Mia, a bright yellow Civic glides to a silent powerle stop behind Harry's pick-up. INT. VINCE'S CIVIC - DAY 21a The driver, VINCE, is a tough costumer in a wife beater, shaved head peppered with fight scars. Tatted and ripped, Vince is an intimidator. His sidekick, JESSE, lanky and baby-faced, a wry instigator, types on a laptop plugged i the car's CPU.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Check it out, Vee. See this hole and peak? That's why your unloading in third. I lengthen injector pulse another millisec, tune the nos timer and you'll bust ten. Watch, I'll ask Harry. Vince SEES that it isn't Harry talking to Mia.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: That ain't Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia wraps two sandwiches in wax paper.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: I'm sure you got big dreams and all, but racing in LA's for keeps. Brian is pure confidence.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: You haven't seen my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you have good shoes. It's a long walk back to Arizona. Then she SEES Vince watching and becomes serious. Brian notes the change, follows her eyeline to the yellow Civic outside and REACTS. Mia hands him a takeout bag.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: See you tonight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 23 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 10.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mia has a secret little grin.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: No, you won't. As Brian crosses to exit, he looks back and exchanges smi with Mia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince didn't like seeing that.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Wassup with this fool? Prettyboy's in there thinking he's racking up numbers.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: If he's driving that truck, Harry's got him sweeping floors or something.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Then he should know. Gotta be punished for his ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Kick his ass. The look Vince gives Jesse says, "Good idea."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An iridescent blue Celica GT and a magenta Eclipse, with subtle yet trippy flower graphics, park across the street From the Celica emerges LEON, tall, half black, cocky. LETTY, exits her Eclipse, a cute young latina who gets he thrills from racing. They lean against their cars and tra knowing looks.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: What would you do if Vee wanted to get down with you?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: . (deadpans) ° Shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Brian exits. And Vince is out of his car like a shot, stepping quickly around it to-- --bump shoulders with Brian. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 25B
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 11.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, bro.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: I'm not your bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia SEES what is going down, slams the TALK button on an intercom.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Dom, get over here. Vince is gonna kick some guy's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOMINIC TORETTO sits at a table eating a bowl of soup. Filthy, grease covered, he sits on newspaper. Studying a video of an illegal drag race. Engrossed, learning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian doesn't want to fight Vince.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Be cool, man. Vince shoves Brian back a step.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what to do. I ain't your bitch-- --WHAM! Brian nails him with an uppercut, CLACKING Vince' teeth together. Vince throws a strong series of punches. Brian blocks wha he can, takes the rest. Waiting for an opening, Brian kic Vince's groin, kicks his knee, and tosses him to the grou in one reactive blitz. INT. TORETTO'S LUNCH COUNTER - DAY 25a Mia hits the intercom again.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Vince is getting his ass kicked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gets Dominic's attention. He gets up -- big guy. FOLLOW HIM through the back kitchen, through a curtain. A pistol tucked into the small of his back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian twisting Vince's arm like bubblegum, Vince in submission.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Dominic trades amazed looks with Mia, Vince never gets whupped.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: «shit... He hops the counter, one hand leaving a greasy print. The other grabbing the snubbed .38 in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Don't you shoot anyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian grinds his Sketcher on Vince's neck. Leon and Letty come running to Vince's aid. Dominic explodes from the sh --charges Brian and pistolwhips him. CRACK! Brian drops t the ground. Stunned, seeing stars. Blood trickles from behind his ear. Vince straggles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You crazy, kicking his ass? I'm the only one who can kick his ass. Vince gives Dominic a wounded look.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: He was in my face.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I'm in your face. Dominic and Brian trade strong-willed glares. Dominic giv Vince a nod, he grabs Brian's wallet. Opens it, shows Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN'S ARIZONA DRIVERS LICENSE
dialogues.text: Brian stands, woozy. Dominic takes the wallet from Vince.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brian Earl Spiller. Serial killer name. He throws it back hard at Brian, who fumbles to catch it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 27 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 13. CONTINUED: ‘ 26

dialogues.speaker: . DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't come around here ever again.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I work around here.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: For Harry? No, I'll call him, You're fired. Don't come back. You do, you're stupid. Serious ass shit. Brian wipes trickling blood from his neck. Brian glances Mia. Who though unhappy for Brian, knows Dominic always triumphs. Brian thinks different. Fixes Dominic with a look, intense and hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Me and you, quarter mile. How about it? Dominic laughs. Vince, Jesse, Leon, Letty grin at Brian's expense; just another small town kid with big city dreams

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me again. Brian frowns. Dominic crosses to the shop, herding Mia inside. Brian looks down, SEES the sandwiches have been crushed in the melee.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: You owe me some food.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Hook him up, Mia. Dominic locks eyes with Brian. The intensity of his stare gives Brian a chill. Dominic enters the shop. Followed by Vince, and Leon. Let gives Brian a long hungry look, disappears inside. Jesse, last, gives Brian a haughty look.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You gotta earn the right to race the Dominator. . Brian SNARLS. Spooking Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry devouring a fresh sandwich as Brian ices his head. Harry is delighted Brian got his comeuppance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 31A
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 14. CONTINUED: ‘ 27

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You're messing with my business. Dominic pays my rent. He's my best customer, my best advertiser. Every time he races, bunch'a kids come in wanting what he's got. He called and wants me to fire you. Over there five minutes and got your head split. What are you gonna do now? Brian looks away. Purses his lips. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's pick-up cruises down the street, Brian behind the wheel, pensive. ‘ An UNMARKED with two plainclothes pulls up behind him. It whoops the SIREN. Red and blues flashing behind the grill Brian REACTS. Pulls over. The driver exits, this is SERGEANT TANNER, older, crusty. He approaches, Brian notices the bump on his head. Brian smiles, innocent.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Who thumped you?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Jack handle fell on me.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: You have to come in. They hit this morning. Four black Civics. Shipping container from Japan. DVDs. Playstations. Notebook computevs. Insured for a million seven. The boss wants to see you. See you there. A beat. Tanner pauses, he can tell something is wrong. Tanner returns to his unmarked. Brian looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 33 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up pulls into the garage of a monstrous home hig in the Hollywood Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set up in the living room of this palatial home. Evidence seals are taped all over the doors. There's no furniture, take out food containers everywhere. A bank of monitors shows Caltrans traffic camera views throughout L.A. Brian enters with the same confidence he brought to the sandwic shop. The WATCH OFFICER, a heavy desk jockey in Dockers, eyes a frozen burrito in the microwave. He gives Brian a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: WATCH OFFICER
dialogues.text: You nail these pieces of shit. We're counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: They don't know what they're in for, sir. Waddaya think of this place?

dialogues.speaker: WATCH OFFICER
dialogues.text: I should'’a been a druglord. Brian grins and climbs the massive staircase. He stops at tall door with a hand lettered sign: STRACPRO SAIC BILKINS -- And under that: THE LION'S DEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set up in an ornately tasteless bedroom. On the wall a photo chart is labeled: ILLEGAL RACING TEAMS There's black teams, Asian teams, Chicano teams. Names an faces we will see again. And there's a mugshot of DOMINIC, photos of VINCE, JESSE, LETTY and LEON, and even Mia, her photo obviously taken f quite a distance. There are charts and graphs, teacher comments from preschool, this is scientific crimefighting its best. Tanner and MUSE, a young plainclothes, sit befo the boss' desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPECIAL AGENT BILKINS a young, really laid back triathlet and ruthless bureaucrat in sporty casuals. They are waiti for: Brian, who enters and lights up the roon (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 16. CONTINUED: ‘ 33

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Brian, want a Coke or water or anything?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm good, Bob. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: You guys okay? Tea or something? Tanner and Muse are fine. Bilkins smiles at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, we're big time. I must have had fifty calls today. A lot of very important people have their eyes on us. Hate to ride your back, Officer O'Conner, but you're our best shot. Let's get the brief. Brian stands, crosses to the wall of photos. He angrily stares at the picture of Dominic. Jams his finger in Dominic's face.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Had my first contact with Toretto today. It went well, I'm sure I can get to him.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Think it's his people?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Six, they're thugs. They lack the sophistication.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Why focus there? Brian looks at Mia's picture and softens a notch. He has go back. Somehow.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: If the Dominator's not popping these trucks, he knows who is. Brian gestures sweepingly at the mosaic of mugshots.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This world revolves around him. These peckernecks worship him, he's never lost a race. Race Wars is happening in a week. It's the "Burning Man" of illegal racing. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He taps Mia Brian beams Blue Revision 05/05/2000 17. (2) ‘ 33

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know our suspects are deep in the scene as evidenced by their vehicles and skills, right? They will be at Race Wars. To beat Dominic Toretto, King of the quarter mile. I'll be there too, because after the racing's done and everyone's raving on ecstasy, our suspects will have a big criminal buddy hug and brag about how bad they are. When they will open their mouths, I will hear them.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Race Wars, huh? San Bernardino Sheriffs been trying to get in there three years running. How you gonna find the thing, Bri? They don't exactly put up posters. 's photo.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to work the sister. She'll know.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Harry Jackson cooperating?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Man has no choice. He's been an outstanding resource. He informed me Toretto's racing tonight at the L.A. Coliseum. I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: You're not racing. Whack some family in a minivan and the city's ass is . wide open for a huge payout. Hear me?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Loud and clear, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: I was leery putting a greenhorn undercover, but you're soldiering well out there. I never had the priwilege to meet your father, but I'm sure he'd be quite proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Amen to that. , he nods a heartfelt thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian unlocks Harry's pick-up. Tanner approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Hold up, O'Conner. . Brian pauses.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't do your job with hands tied behind your back, Sometimes it's easier to ask for forgiveness than to ask for permission, Do what you have to tonight, but remember, that's an eighty thousand dollar car and we have to return it without a scratch.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (grins gratefully) I'll use my best judgement.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: I know you will. Tanner looking at Brian, there is a strong connection between these two.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I worry about you. Toretto's a psycho, beating a guy half to death and all. I couldn't take it if you took a bullet in the back of the head. A beat, Brian darkens, intense.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: That will never happen to me. Never. Tanner looking at Brian, with more to say. But he just claps Brian on the shoulder and nods for him to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: « LIMP BIZKIT pumps. The city below wears a beautiful suit lights. Below, the Coliseum draws car headlights like mot to a flame. cuT TO:  35 36 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling slow, the Alpine THUMPING. Brian, jotting license numbers, hides his LAPD radio under the seat. A couple MINISKIRTS wipe frame, making Brian smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what it's all about; cruising. LA's tribes brough together by their cars. Chicanos, Asians, Whiteboys, Blacks. Brian is in a slow moving line of awesome cars. L riders. Plush Humvees. Pimp Daddy Mercedes and Beemers. And of course, street racers in a rainbow of intense colo Brian passes a parked lowrider, brimming with hot GIRLS a two HOMIES play videogames on a built-in console. Brian gets lots of smiles from the chicas. As a dozen different BASSLINES thump. Brian pulls into a huge parking lot where racers gather. His green Supra gets lots of stares and nods. Brian parks, gets out of the car, sits on the hood. HECTOR SILVA approaches him. Shaved head, a tattoo on his neck. Built like a fireplug. He checks out the Supra.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Sweet ride. Big ass intercooler. What'cha running under there? Brian gives Hector a look. Nice try. Hector smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta find out the hard way, huh? Brian nods: yes. They tap fists.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Brian. : ° Hector points at his car, a vicious looking Acura Integra Two of his HOMIES stand there, looking bad. Their lowride caddies repose in B.G.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Quarter mile. Thousand bones. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 20.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No, man I can't.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Why you out here then?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Waiting for the Dominator. Hector gestures at a JAPANESE TEAM gathered around a Blac Civic. A BLACK TEAM is busy preening a gold 66 Chevelle.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Get in line, and know that homeboy won't race for less than your car.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I know the stakes. Whose Civic?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Danny Yamato's, goes light speed. He's the cat with the fine-ass hottie. Bruthas be running a supercharged 327. Old school Chevys're more played out than Stairway to Heaven. Sadness. (eyeing the Supra) Maybe you got it. Luck, dude. Hector crosses back to his Z. Brian has his eyes on the Japanese. DANNY YAMATO, the boss, looks sharp in a knit Versace shirt, his arm draped around his exquisite GIRLFRIEND. An approaching engine GROWLS ferociously. Heads swivel, finding:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Rolling up in a fiery red Mazda RX7. It is one scary vehicle. Dominic gets out, as intimidating as his car. Adlibs of girls SHOUTING his name. He's popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia steps out of Dominic's RX7. She SEES Brian. REACTS,

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian and Mia trade smiles. Vince pulls up with Jesse. Then Letty's Eclipse and Leon's Celica. Everyone gets out and gathers, Mia with them. Leon has a scanner, listens t the POLICE DISPATCHERS. Danny Yamato and EDWIN BISHOP, jailhouse big, cross to Dominic, shake. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 2i.

dialogues.speaker: EDWIN
dialogues.text: How we doing this? Jesse begins taping Dominic's hands with cloth tape. Dominic nods for Hector.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Winner gets both losers' cars. No second best. Hector's going to hold the titles. Vince hands Dominic's DMV pinkslip to Hector. Edwin casts confident glance at his Chevelle. Forks his over. Then Danny Yamato gives his up.

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD TITLE
dialogues.text: ARIZONA emblazoned on it is laid in Hector's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian has joined them.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Add mine to the kitty. The crowd is watching Brian. Mia too, secretly thrilled. Vince and Leon are ready to jump Brian. As are the Black and Japanese teams. Dominic glaring at Brian, unaccustome to disobedience. Edwin gives Brian a disdainful once over

dialogues.speaker: EDWIN
dialogues.text: We all here 'cause we somebody.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Can't just climb in the ring with Holyfield ‘cause you think you box.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I lese, I'm gone. I win... Brian smiles. Dominic doesn't. A beat. Danny and Edwin wait on Dominic, it's his call.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Pop the hood. A beat as Brian considers it. Then Brian agrees, crossed his car. Dominic gives Jesse a look, together they follow Brian.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Let's see how they do it in Arizona. Who built it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 37 38 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 22. CONTINUED: (3) i 36

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: My cousin and me. Brian opens his hood. Wow. It looks like something out of a spaceship. Jesse REACTS, admiringly does the math.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: One point eight bar of boost. Twin turbo, nitrous, eight fifty CC injectors, Greddy exhaust. HKS intercooler and megaflow. Racing wastegate. Type R blowoff. You know it's ported and polished with HKS cams. Lotta R and D in there. 600 plus horses at the wheels. You wish you buiit this. I wish I built this. Dominic silences Jesse with a look. Dominic, pokerfaced, measures Brian with piercing eyes. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You're in. Let's go. Brian smiles. Letty witness an exchange of looks between him and Mia. Letty crosses to Brian's Supra as he gets in Something surprisingly innocent and awkward about her.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Thing's go bad for you, I can givé you a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Home's awful far.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Mine's not. She smiles. Brian smiles, gets in his car. Mia, hitching ride with Leon, stares daggers at Letty. Dominic, getting into his Mazda, doesn't miss the drama. curt TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINES in SCREAM in the night. Dominic leads the way. Followed by Edwin's Chevelle, Danny's Civic and Brian's Supra. The teams caravan after them, and a long line of sexy spectator cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is thrilled. He looks over and REACTS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: vince's Civic driving alongside. Jesse and Vince staring.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian looks back coolly. And guns it. Pulls ahead and get on Dominic's tail. Who turns onto a boulevard. The carava follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic suddenly STOPS. SCREECHING to a halt. Edwin stops aligning his bumpers with Dominic's. Danny too. Brian gets the picture, stops too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian backs up to the others.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: A dozen Cars fan out with practiced choreography as they stake out a drag strip, blocking sidestreets, oncoming lanes. Their DRIVERS coordinating on Nextel phones.

dialogues.speaker: SPECTATOR CARS
dialogues.text: Park on the roadside. A quarter mile's worth.

dialogues.speaker: A LOWRIDER CADDIE
dialogues.text: Stops, the DRIVER hops out and spraypaints a finish line. Leon pulls up, Mia in his passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: THE STARTING LINE
dialogues.text: Hector arrives, gets out and stands between the waiting racers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edwin can't lose. Beads of sweat on his forehead. His engine SNAPS and POPS hungrily. He looks over at Danny Yamato and grins. . -

dialogues.speaker: EDWIN
dialogues.text: Got rice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny grins back at Edwin.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Got balls? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He tightens the fourpoint harness, locking him into the Recaro seat. The interior is stripped, a big nitrous tank where a rear seat should be. He reaches back, opens the tank's nitrous valve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian checks his watch. Nervous. Mouth dry. Looks over at Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic stares back with piteous disregard. Brian is a nuisance to be dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian steels himself, he's made a decision.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Screw it. I'm beating him. He looks over his gauges and readouts. Brian begins punching buttons. His turbo controller BEEPS. He starts the racing program on the dash computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handmade interior with an experimental feel. Dominic pu in tiny earphones. CLICKS play on the MP3 player in his pocket. MUSIC blasts in his ears. He checks his computer. Hits some buttons. Gives Hector a nod. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector slowly raises both arms.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUR DRIVERS
dialogues.text: Making the same moves. LEFT HANDS grab steering wheels. LEFT FEET step on clutches. RIGHT HANDS grab gearshifts. RIGHT FEET light on the gas. Four tachs blipping around 2000RPM.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR'S ARMS
dialogues.text: Drop. Engines SCREAM. The four floor it. Clutches up. Tires spin and catch. Three cars surge forward.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN'S SUPRA
dialogues.text: Spins tires. Lost traction is lost time. He clutches correctly and takes off. 42 43 44 45 46 47 48  49 50 Si 52 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 25. INT. BRIAN'S SUPRA (MOVING) - NIGHT 4g RPMs climb. The turbo WHINES. The shiftlight. Off the throttle. RPMs drop. The bypass HISS. Clutch. 2nd gear. Throttle. RPMs climb. 50MPH. Stage one nitro-- --a solenoid CLICKS open. Nitrous floods the intake manifold -- BOOM! Adding another 100 horsepower. Brian is slammed into his seat. RPMs climbing... The shiftlight. Off the throttle -- clutch in -- 3rd gear ~- clutch out. Throttle. Faster and faster. 80MPH. The car shaking. Again, the shiftlight. Off the throttle -- clutch -- 4th gear, clutch pedal up. Stomp the gas. 100MPH The car shudders violently making Brian's teeth CHATTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jittering chaos. WARNING lights. Redlined gages. Shrill ALARMS. Smoke fills the car. The ENGINE strains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic in the lead. Edwin close behind. Then Danny. Brian gaining, his exhaust shooting flame. INT. EDWIN'S CHEVELLE (MOVING) - NIGHT sl Brian passes him.

dialogues.speaker: EDWIN
dialogues.text: Nooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic shifting, precise, mechanical. 100MPH. Waiting fo the perfect moment. The MUSIC in his ear nears crescendo. Dominic hits the nitrous. Stunning acceleration. DOMINIC'S FOV . . Smooth sailing, a beautiful SLO MO waltz to Brian's frant jitterbug. The road ahead inviting and open. His ENGINE HOWLS its controlled war cry.

dialogues.speaker: IN HIS REARVIEW
dialogues.text: Is Brian's Supra. A neon specter right on his bumper.  53 54 55 56 57 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing 119MPH. A scary RATTLING. Brian pulis alongside Dominic's RX7. The world outside a blur. The wind WHISTLE into the car. The gages mounted on the window pillar pop off. More smoke. Wires in the dash short -- SPARKS. Two bolts POP off the floor plating. Hit the roof by Brian's head. He keeps going. Impending disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic drives with Zen precision. The harmony of man and machine. He casts an almost lazy glance at Brian's bright green Supra alongside. A beat of eye contact. Dominic throws it into 5th gear-- The computer hits the nitrous. VROOM!

dialogues.speaker: THE FINISH LINE AHEAD 55
dialogues.text: Dominic nosing ahead of Brian. Edwin is a couple lengths behind. Then Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shiftlight. Brian slams it into 5th. His computer lights off stage three nitrous-- The car SHUDDERS. 135MPH. Brian crushes the wheel in his hands. The speedometer climbing. Brian nose to nose with Dominic. His car wants to tear itself to pieces, There's the finish line. Brian and Dominic dead even. The Brian pulls ahead. By an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laser beam shoots from curb to curb, a timing device. Hector's homeboy videotapes the approaching cars. Yards to go. Dominic seems to will his car forward, squeezing out every last horse. ° It's close. 149MPH. Dominic takes the lead. By a hair. Dominic's front bumper breaks the laser beam. He wins. Brian lags by a few thousandths of a second. Several car lengths behind, Edwin crosses the line, then Danny a split second later.  58 59 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian throws it in neutral, stomps the brake pedal. The SCREECH of heavy duty brakes. The car slows quickly. SHAKING and RATTLING. Brian trying to keep it straight. T speedometer falls fast. Brian lets out a WHOOP! His eyes are wild, hair tussled. mad grin. Brian has been struck by emotional lightning. H LIKES racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The racers slow, do U-Turns and return to the finish. The cars, tires are hot.. Brian's Supra smokes. SPECTATORS rush forward. The three Racers. get out of the cars. Hector pulls up in his Integra. Gets out. Hands the titles to Dominic. Who casually folds them, tucks them in pocket, never expecting any other outcome. Dominic SEES Brian leaning against the Supra. Grinning li an idiot, high on adrenaline and danger.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Why the smile? You lost. Brian spits blood, he bit his tongue. Mia gives Brian an impressed nod. Dominic looking at Brian, measuring him an as he unwinds tape from his hands.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I had you.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You never had me. You never had your car. Over clutching, watching the shiftlight, not double footing like you should. Lucky that final nos boost didn't blow the welds on the intake. Dominic nods at Jesse, who squat beside the Supra looking for fluid leaks, angry about its mistreatment, he gives Brian a look. °

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me and the mad scientist gotta rip apart the block and swap out the bearings you smoked. (eyes Brian) Don't matter if you win by an inch or amile. Winning's winning. I used just enough to get me there. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59  59 60 61 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 28. CONTINUED: ‘ 59

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got schooled. Learn your lesson and go home. Dominic walks away. Brian can't help but to be impressed. Brian looks to Mia. Both saddened it can't be different. Mia looks away. Letty feels Brian's pain, she motions him over. Then Vince crumples a dollar and drops it at Brian' feet.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Here's your bus money. LAUGHS. The other teams, the spectators, watch Brian. Adlibs of "Punk," and "Fool." Never more the outsider tha now, Brian's anger boils, he knows he screwed up big. Watching Hector hand Dominic the titles. Suddenly from Hector's Nextel:

dialogues.speaker: FILTERED VOICE
dialogues.text: Cops! Cops! Cops!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Cops! Cops! Cops! SPECTATORS scramble as SHOUTS echo the warning. Approachi SIRENS 0.S. Dominic dives in his RX7. Shouts to his fello racers:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You know where to bring my cars! SCREECH! He splits. Brian SEES Mia, then loses sight of her in the pandemonium. The sound of a HELICOPTER, a searchlight sweeps the street from high above. Cars scatter like cockroaches. Brian unsure, then he jump in the Supra and PEELS OUT after Dominic. Flashing lights as six black and whites ROAR onto the Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a sharp right onto a major street.” And another sharp right, into a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a small building full of doctor's offices. The red RX7 corkscrews down. Finds a space by the stairwell. Dominic exits with a car cover, heaves it over his baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic exits the stairwell. Walks along, his hands in hi pockets. Mr. Innocent as he strolls toward the MTA subway entrance down the block. A COP CAR in a big hurry blasts right past him. Dominic feels like the cat that ate the canary. Until he hears tw GROWLING cop V8's behind him, CHIRPING tires. Opening DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: COP LOUDSPEAKER
dialogues.text: Put your hands up! Show your hands! Dominic runs for it. TWO COPS exit the subway on foot. There's an alley. Dominic sprints into it.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLIGHTS APPROACH
dialogues.text: They're blinding. Trapped, Dominic squints into them. And hears:

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: C'mon! Get in! Hurry up! Brian doesn't have to ask twice. Dominic runs to the Supr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic hops in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Go! Before they block us in! Brian has an impish grin as he punches the gas. A CRUISER stops in front of the Supra. Blocked, Brian throws it in reverse, peels out backwards down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CRUISER
dialogues.text: Blocks this end. The Supra brakes, skidding backwards. Closer to the cruiser, about to T-bone it. «Brian whips t wheel, turning backwards onto the sidewalk. He clears the cruiser. Throws it in lst and mashes the ga The Supra takes off and accelerates up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time to relax. He turns left on a small street. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 66 67 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 30. CONTINUED: ‘ 65 Makes a sharp turn into a driveway. Cuts through the bloc turns right onto WASHINGTON BOULEVARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE CRUISERS slide sideways into his rearview.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian yanks the handbrake, jerks the wheel. The world outside rotates as he does a 180. Brian's car rolls backwards. Ist gear. He stomps the throttle -- His tires spin, smoke ~~ Stopping his car and shooting it forward. But now facing the two cruisers. They're coming right at him, traveling abreast. Dominic REACTS. Brian doesn't flinch. He throws it in 3rd, stomps the go juice and goes. The Supra threads the needle, barely slipping between the two police cars. Dominic gives Brian a look -- Well done. Brian floors it and sails up the road. He is gone before the cruisers can turn around. Dominic watches the sky.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: We gotta spoof the helicopters. Kill your lights and stay on the sidestreets. Brian kills his lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're safely in Long Beach. Refineries and oil storage tanks line the lonely industrial road they travel.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Snatched you from the jaws of the Man.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You saved.my ass. I already did two years in Lompoc. I ain't going back. I owe you one. You got serious sack, my friend. They clasp hands. Brian smiles. Because he knows he's finally gotten to Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Can I keep my car? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 31. 67 CONTINUED: ‘ 67

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I'm grateful, not stupid. There is an ominous RUMBLING in the distance. Growing louder. Brian and Dominic trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Supra is surrounded by something out of a manga carto six HURRICANE MOTORCYCLES with wicked graphics. The RIDER are in nice designer casuals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They box him in, forcing him to slow. The RIDER alongside Brian's window aims a Mac-11 machine pistol with a sound suppressor screwed on the barrel. Brian.weighs his option

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Stop, man. These fools don't play. Brian reluctantly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RIDERS dismount and remove their helmets. Vietnamese with bleach blonde spiked hair. They surround the car. Brian and Dominic show their hands. LANCE NGUYEN, with the Mac-11, holds it discretely inside his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: . LANCE
dialogues.text: Get out unless you want to get blasted. Brian and Dominic get out. A new crimson Mustang speeds toward them, making a dramatic entrance. A striking ASIAN GIRL in the passenger seat. Out steps Lance's boss, PETE TRAN, in a $500 shirt, platinum jewelry. A regally imposi class act with a scowl. He crosses to Dominic. With a 40 ounce beer in a bag.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Why are you down here, Toretto? |

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Wassup, Pete? Gonna give me a shot at that ‘Stang?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No. You cheat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 32.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I never cheated no one in a drag. Not my fault you brought your little sister's bigwheel to a man's race. Brian looking at Dominic like he's crazy. So is Pete.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Food for thought. You're not from Long Beach, yet here you are talking shit. (to Brian) That your ride?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: It was. It's his. Dominic looking at the bottle in Pete's hand.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: No, it's not. I haven't taken delivery.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Then it's nobody's car? Somebody put a lot of work in this. Lot of time. What to you think, Lance?

dialogues.speaker: LANCE
dialogues.text: It's an amazing machine.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Nice ride, right? Look at these curves, beautiful. Somebody loves this car. Difficult to believe it's nobody's car. He gives Lance a nod. Lance grins. BZZZ22Z2Z2Z22DDDDDDT ~~ The high rate machine pistol soun a ripping canvas. Bullets punch into the Supra. Glass SHATTERS. Lance pours hot shellcasings from his helmet into a compartment on his bike. SNAPS a fresh mag into the Mac. Pete heaves the forty into the car, it SHATTERS on the nitrous tank. Fumes swirl like a heat mirage. Pete lights a cigarette with a matchbook. He lets the who book ignite. Brian wrinkles his nose. Smells gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: BRAIN
dialogues.text: Don't do it. Don't fry it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: T1A
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 33.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian can't move with Lance on the Mac. Pete tosses the matchbook inside.

dialogues.speaker: WHOOMP
dialogues.text: Everyone steps back from the burning Supra. Pete and his team laugh as flames reach skyward.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Don't come screwing around. You have no business here. Pete gets in his Mustang. His team climbs on their bikes and take off. Brian and Dominic watch the Supra as it bur like a blast furnace. They trade looks, and run for it. The gasket to the nitrous tank melts--

dialogues.speaker: KA-THOOMP
dialogues.text: The tank detonates, blowing the carbon fiber body panels like paper, shattering the frame. A jagged piece of rollcage SIZZLES past Brian's head. When the worst is over, Brian and Dominic dare look back. burning tires rolls toward them pathetically. They trade looks and walk away. The two silhouetted by flame. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modest. Working class. Big trees in the front yard. The team's cars parked on bare oil-stained dirt. A light on i the second storey window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles, incense, trippy music. Wild paintings cover the walls, planets and suns and chrome nudes caressing in a v of stars. With an airbrush stylus in her steady hand, Mia add highlights to a canvas of sensuously amorphous femini curves. She HEARS a car pull up. Looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic and Brian exit a goofy yellow taxi.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 34. CONTINUED: ‘ TIA Mia does a doubletake -- Yes, it's Brian. The smile that blooms on her face says everything. She returns to her painting. Surprised to discover her hand is now trembling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shabby old furniture with a few electronic luxuries. A great sound system. Leon, Jesse, Vince and Letty split a pack and play a racing video game. Dominic enters with Brian. Shuts off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You guys are real worried. Vince tosses Dominic a beer. He passes it to Brian. The team REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Why'd you bring the buster here?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: He's cool. Didn't see you looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Cops almost got me. That shit was orchestrated.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Came in from every direction. They had undercovers watching us. Brian just sips his beer. Dominic hops on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vee, a beer. Vince tosses him another beer. Letty pats the empty cushi next to her, smiles at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: You can sit here. She beams as Brian crosses and sits by her,”

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Homeboy stymied the cops. It was artistic. This cat is sick. Brian smiles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 35. CONTINUED: ‘ 72

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then he rolls us to Long Beach, pissing off the locals. They put his ride out of it's misery with a Mac, whole damn clip. Then Sneaky Pete had a Vietnamese Barbecue. That car blew apart like the space shuttle. Shocked looks are traded. Jesse grabs his head in horror.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Noooo. That's wrong. That's so wrong.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Goddamn gooks. They value nothing cause they got it all. Five hundred dollar shirts. Engine's worth thirty large. Dinks got all the best shit. (looks at Brian) You know they're crooked. They're scamsters. Pretending not to, Brian hangs on Vince's every word.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: C'mon, Vee. They designed our cars and invented ramen. Vince rolls his eyes. Plays the crash compilation video. Dominic turns to Brian with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You owe me a ten second car. Brian REACTS. Vince flashes him a wary look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen to everyone, Mia stands at the bottom of the stair She SEES a smiling Brian sitting next to a thrilled Letty Mia unhappily turns and climbs the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian enters with a-big grin. Tanner, Muse and Bilkins ar tense. Bilkins pulls a large ziplock from his drawer. Inside is Brian's police radio. Fire scorched, ash white.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Here's your radio. Long Beach PD recovered the UC car full of bulletholes and burnt to a crisp. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 36. CONTINUED: ‘ 73

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Highway Patrol expects it returned in good working order. Brian is unfazed, cocky.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: It wasn't street legal. That's why it was rotting in their yard, they can't auction it. It was an impound, didn't cost them a dime. Let them bitch, sir. They can't produce a receipt saying they bought it.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: He's right. We can paperfuck 'em. Off the hook for the Supra, Bilkins anger ratchets down a tad. Before he can speak, Brian makes a "time out" sign.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Their loss is our gain, sir. Brian Grosses to the wall of mugshots and begins moving t around. Bilkins, Tanner and Muse watch curiously. Finally Brian gets to the Viet Long Beach Team. He swaps Lance's photo with Pete Tran's.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Sneaky Pete's the shot caller. Lance is just a triggerman. Carries a silenced Mac submachinegun. He sliced and diced the Supra. Pete Tran did the cooking. I say we put them at the top of the suspect list. Off the perplexed looks of his peers:

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've been sitting on Toretto's couch, drinking his beer, getting the short course on who's who. Muse and Tanner trade incredulous looks. Bilkins leans back, looks over the chart of street racers. Brian leans his desk, looks him in the eye, softly: «

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir... I'm in. A beat. Bilkins purses his lips.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Excellent. And you believe Toretto is not our hijacker? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 37.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, I'd like to send a strong message to the illegal racing community by incarcerating their Grand Pooh-Bah. He's got one violent felony, any dirt you can dig up will bury him. Can do? Brian REACTS. He doesn't like the idea but will have to d as he's told.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Can do, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Get a location on Race Wars?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No, sir. Not yet. First I need another car.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Wilshire OPG has a Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No thanks, Sergeant. It's all about rice power. I'll kick around the impounds and see what I can scare up. Bilkins tosses Brian a new radio.

dialogues.speaker: BILKINS
dialogues.text: Keep it up, Brian. As Brian stands and crosses to the door:

dialogues.speaker: MUSE
dialogues.text: Gonna go work Toretto's sister, lucky guy? I spank off to her surveillance photos. Muse and Tanner laugh. Brian shoots Muse an angry look.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Great, Muse. Great. Brian exits. Tanner and Muse trade a look.

dialogues.speaker: 715A
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia unloads supplies from the back of a pick-up. Brian pulls up in a battered Nissan 240SX. The entire passenger side is crushed. The front trim missing. The windshield shattered, headlights dangle from their wires. Mia watche Brian get out and enter the shop. Mia stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Nice shitbox. Dominic's at the house.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Here i am. Now you saw me. Brian, wondering what is wrong, helps her unload the truc

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Brian, I think you're in good hands with Letty. A lot of guys like her. You're lucky, she's real picky. You should go for it. She's so pretty.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm not into Letty.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Everyone's into Letty.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm not everyone.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Right, one of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Right. Maybe I'm into you. Mia crosses her arms and studies him.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: There someone loving you in Arizona?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe. And maybe I didn't love that someone back and maybe that's why I left. Fresh start. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 39,

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: You say goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Mia, I didn't run away. I'm not like that. Let's have a drink tonight and I'll tell you the whole sordid saga. We'll kick back and have some laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: On the curb with some forties?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: We can do better. How about margaritas and mariachis. Nachos? She considers it a beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: I better not. And that's that. Brian regards her with a frown.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't you ever just want to party? Put on Ice-Ice Baby and do the running man? Brian does a goofy dance move. Mia can't help smiling.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Please don't do that. Okay. You win; margaritas. But only maybe. Jury's still out on you. Brian stops dancing, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe is acceptable. Mia opens the door to the shop and Brian carries in a sta of heavy boxes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic and Jesse work on a VW bug in the shade of the trees. A speaker THUMPS a baseline. Brian pulls up in the 240SX. He gets out and crosses to the bug.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Got a car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 40.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dominic and Jesse cross to the battered, shattered Nissan Dominic REACTS, gives Brian a look.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Dude, that's a ten minute car.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You gonna tow it or push it across the finish? Unfazed, Brian pops the hood. Motions for Jesse to take a look. Jesse does, likes what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Omigod. A Skyline motor. Jesse grins at the rare find, digs in the engine. Love at first sight. Dominic sees for himself and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Good find, man.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: This will decimate all. (a beat) After you put fifteen grand in it. More if we have to overnight parts from Japan. Brian REACTS, he doesn't have the cash,

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Put it on my tab at Harry's. Race Wars is coming up.. Heard of that? Brian shakes his head: no.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's something to see, Brian. I want you to roll out there with us. Gonna make money off your ass. You'll make twice back what I loan you racing suckers. No shortage of them. (a beat) Then, if you're down, I'll race,you again. We'll go double or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Den't do it. Brian is hooked, he taps fists with Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN '
dialogues.text: Shit, yeah. I'm down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'll give you a parts list. The special order stuff you have to get on now.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Where do I de the wrenching? Dominic starts walking up his driveway. Unlocks his large garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic opens the door and light spills in. Brian standin next him. Racks of tools cover the walls of tools. Lathes and drill presses gleam, the machines old but well maintained.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: My tools are your tools. Brian looks at Dominic and smiles in gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, Letty and Leon walk past the house to the garage i back. Vince, carrying a 12 pack, stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard work in the Toretto garage, Dominic, Brian and Jesse are winching the engine out of the 240SX. Brian just told punchline, their LAUGHTER is heard over their MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Vince turns and walks away, Letty and Leon follow. Of course Letty looks back.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: We're gone.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: We got nowhere else to go. He's cool.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: He's not, Leon. He's on Dominic's ass like a fag in heat. He gets on mine, I'm putting a bullet in his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Shut up, Vince. Don't start shooting people. He's just tripping on being in LA. He don't know what it's about yet.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: You know he's trying to hook up with Mia. Fool's dying to hit it.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Mia won't kick down... I will.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I know you will, Letty. Letty shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: A COMPUTER SCREEN 719
dialogues.text: It shows a photoreal 240SX beefed up for racing. The car rotates to reveal the undercarriage. A column of suspension components on one side of the screen. The cursor clicks on the Koni shocks. Drags and drops the on the car. A complex graph of performance parameters changes accordingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse working on his laptop. Brian sits next to him, fascinated, both are filthy, tired.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Koni adjustables save us two pounds and give us better holeshot. Mia sets down a huge pot of spaghetti sauce. NOISE at the front door. Dominic instinctively puts a hand on his gun. But it's just Vince, Letty and Leon. They enter noisily a take seats around the table. .

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Just in time. Letty grins at Vince. Amused by his grudging change of heart.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: What? I gotta eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 43.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jesse. Eat. Jesse snaps the laptop shut and grabs a plate. They tear hunks of bread from big loaves. Bowls of sauce, pasta and salad are passed around the table. Mia looks at the oilstains on Dominic's glass. .

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Could'a washed up. Dominic admires his oil black arms.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: This is my warpaint. Mia sits across from Brian. Watches everyone shove food into their faces.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: I remember when we used to say grace. Dominic looks at her, threatens to throw his greasy arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Best little girl in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Get off me, no! No! Dominic! Okay, I love you too. Shut up and eat. Dominic relents. Mia smiling. She watches Brian eat. Studying him, he seems content in this newfound family. M grabs a camera from the china hutch. Aims it at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Wait. THE FLASH. Brian didn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do your portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic and Brian walk across the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: How you getting home?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Bus, I guess. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Wanna ride? cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cruise through San Pedro. Brian is anxious and tries not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: We're nowhere near my crib.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in San Pedro. Oil wells in B.G. suck crude like steel sandbirds. Dominic solemnly unlocks a padlock. Pull the garage door open. He gestures for Brian to enter the dark warehouse. Brian does, hesitatingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. Florescents flicker on. Revealing a shrine t Doug Toretto. Racing pennants, pictures, trophies. Flamesuits, helmets. And in the middle, a covered car. Dominic pulls off the cover. Revealing a '90 Buick Regal. This is one bad car, not the prettiest, the baddest. Dominic opens the hood, exposing the awesome engine.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Me and my dad built her. Nine hundred horses. A beast. Know what she ran in Paimdale? Brian shakes his head: no.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nine seconds flat. My dad was driving. So much damn torque, ghassis twisted coming off the line. Old man barely kept her on the track,

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What's your best run?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Never driven her. Scares the shit out of me. Guess I don't have my pop's balis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 45.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian sees Dominic isn't kidding, REACTS. Dominic takes a framed newspaper clipping down from the wall and hands it Brian. It's headlined: RACE FAVORITE KILLED IN FINAL LAP

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He died doing what he loved. Quit pipefitting at the Navy Yard and hit the pro stock car circuit. He was coming up. Last race of the season, I just turned eighteen. Ken Jorgenson, this old salt he was beating, came up from inside the final turn and clipped his bumper. Put him into the wall at a hundred twenty. PUSH IN ON -- Dominic's pained eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Flames consuming a race car. The DRIVER writhes in agony.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I watched him burned to death. I could hear him screaming.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SCENE
dialogues.text: Dominic is choked with emotion. They look at each other. beat of connection.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Week later I ran into Jorgenson at the Pomona Raceway. I wailed on him with a wrench until I couldn't lift my arms. Almost killed him. Dominic takes the clipping, hangs it up.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was wrong as hell, it was just an accident. . Dominic squats before the car, contemplating it, suddenly seeming old and weary.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I live my life a quarter mile at a time, Brian. For those few seconds, man... It's just me and my ride and a little road. Nothing else matters. The mortgage, that loser sandwich shop, my team and all their bullshit. For those few seconds, I'm free. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 86 87 88 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 46. CONTINUED: (2) ‘ 84 Dominic stands, embarrassed by his show of sentiment. He looks at Brian. It's okay, Brian's eyes are sympathetic. The warmth of friendship binds them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen lowriders and a familiar 300Z2X RUMBLE up to the shop. Speakers THUMPING Latin trip-hop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tends the counter. Hector Silva enters with six tou ripped and tatted HOMEBOYS. Through the window, six more can be seen watching the cars.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Wassup, dude? They tap fists.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hey, loco. Glad we didn't race. I'd be out some lunch money. Got hectic when the cops swooped, huh? How's Dominic treating your Supra?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Not as nice as I did. Hector hands Brian a parts list.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: Hook me up. Want four of everything-- Watcha, Beto. Pasa la feria pa'ca. BETO pulls a thick stack of twenties from his baggy Dicki Slaps it on the counter. Brian looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'll hook you up. Brian enters Hector's part numbers into the*computer. INSERT COMPUTER SCREEN -- The parts are for Honda Civics. Brian tries to hide his reaction as he reads the screen. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian cruises in Harry's pick-up along East LA's main dra PEOPLE out, shopping at the colorful markets. Street vendors sell inflatable action heroes and corn on the cob

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. EAST L.A. NEIGHBORHOOD -— NIGHT 90 Tired old houses interspersed with garages and machine shops. Brian is parked, eating a burger, reading the pape He's watching one of the garages. The only one still open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big metal service bay door rolls down. Two really big HOMIES exit. They get in a 79 Olds Cutlass glistening und a streetlight and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian grabs a duffle off the floor, sets it on the seat. unzips it, digs through the tools inside. Grabs a hydraul boltcutter. He puts on a ballcap, about to get out, catch his own eyes in the rearview. He's about to cross the lin and knows it. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a side door, Brian goes to work on the padlock with th hydraulic cutter. SNAP! cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side door opens. Brian rushes inside. A keypad is BEEPING. Brian follows the wiring up the wall with his maglite. WHAM! Brian kicks in a closet door. A big steel alarmbox on the wall. He unplugs it from the phone jack. Relaxes a notch. Then he hears: A DIALTONE. The ALARM'S MODEM is DIALING... Brian panics. Kicks a hole in the drywall under the box. Reaches up behind the box. And yanks out... A second phone jack. SILENCE. Brian smiles. He checks out the garage. SEES the stack of boxes from Harry's store. A lowrider on the lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 94 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts rifling drawers and cabinets. He hears VOICES and MUSIC. He warily crosses to the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the window is pile of old tires, a fence, then th back yard of someone's house. Where the dozen HOMEBOYS fr earlier kick back and have some cold ones.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian quietly retreats from the window. He crosses to fou cars off to one side, under car covers. Brian lifts a cover -- A Honda Civic, white not black, Th next is brown. The next two both blue, stock machines, on beginning their transformation into. performance machines Brian is clearly disappointed. He checks on the Homeboys, everything seems cool. Crosses to the side door cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian furtively closes the door. Approaches the corner. A walks into a SHOTGUN-- --Held by Vince, not a homeboy.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: (whispers) I don't care if there's a dozen eses over there, I'll blow you in half. Vince knees him in the balls. Brian doubles over, trying not to moan aloud.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE, (CONT 'D)
dialogues.text: You fight dirty. Like a cop. Move it. Vince presses the muzzle against Brian's ear, marches alo the building to an alley full of old tires, rusted muffle and body panels. Jesse waits in his VW with the engine running. A cigarette glows in the shadows. Out steps Dominic, revealing himself. His face cold, scary.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Brian, this is one of those times where you need to be very clear about what you say. Nobody's hurt yet. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, shit, what'd I do-~-?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: --Shut up. Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I ain't taking no chances after losing my Supra. At Race Wars Hector's team is gonna run four Civics with stock engines, T66 turbos with nos and four inch exhaust. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Gonna distort the fuel curve but if they go plus fifty on the pulse width, it'll pop the injectors open quicker.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What do y'all think I was doing? All paranoid and what not, coming at me with the big stuff. What'd I do to you?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I like to know who I kick it with. (to Vince) Vee, put the gage up. Vince lowers the shotgun. Glares at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What? You got a nutshot. We're even.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You gonna check out everyone's shit?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Many as I can. Already know what y'all got. If you're down, there's a cocksucker whose cash I gotta take. Like to know his poker hand. You down? Dominic and Vince trade looks, they're down. Brian smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads: TRAN'S COLLISION AND PERFORMANCE (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 97 98 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 50. CONTINUED: ‘ 96 Jesse's bug glides to the curb across the street without lights. Three FIGURES get out and move into shadow. Brian Dominic and Vince eye the building. A formidable structur Brian notes a fire escape on the adjacent building. Point it out to his companions. They run across the street. Up the FIRE ESCAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting from one side to get a good running start, the three sprint across the roof -- jump the perilous drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Then a shaft of moonlight stabs down from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skylight has just been jimmied open. Brian's HEAD AND SHOULDERS appear in silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drop is deadly. Dangling lube, oil and air hoses are the only way down.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian dangles from the skylight. He begins to swing. Back and forth. He kicks out his legs, snags the hose bundle with them. He slides down the hoses to the floor. Then Dominic joins Brian. And Vince. Now on terra firma, the three trade relieved looks. Brian steers his maglite across the darkness. Illuminatin the impressive equipment. This is the most elaborate gara we've seen yet. There's a dyno. Diagnostic gear. And a fancy pick-up for errands. Even Dominic is, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Damn, State of the art. Big bucks.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: We gotta jack some of this shit. Two racers are on hydraulic lifts. Brian crosses to one, aims his maglite up into the engine compartment. No engin (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They cross to the other lift. And stare up into another empty engine compartment. The three share a look.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the engines at? Brian wanders’ toward four small cars closely parked toge under the same tarp. They have Brian's full attention. Dominic's pocket CHIRPS, he pulls out his cell and checks the caller ID, angered by the distraction.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: What, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is slumped in his seat, terrified. Watching the Vie Long Beach Team return to the garage en masse. There's a dozen Hurricanes, several cars -- Pete's Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (into phone) They're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian steps into the moonlight as he reaches to lift the tarp...

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC

The only thing that made dad happy was building and racing cars. He chased my mom off. She hid in New York or New Jersey, not sure which. I kind'a wish she'd taken us with. Dad could be scary, I get it. Future looked bright for a while. We took in some strays and made our own family Dominic got his operators license and drove big rigs and I was in art college. Speeding tickets and student loans killed those. dreams. It's Brian's turn to give a reassuring hand squeeze.
