dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sergeant Tanner, Pete Tran is our guy. I know I'm right. I learned from the best cop who ever wore a badge: my dad. He taught me it's black and white. We gotta do our job and stomp these insects, like the dick-lice son- of-an-asshole who shot my daddy in the head.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter who you lock up, you can't bring him back. You've always been a good kid but it scares the shit out of me to hear you talk like that. Black and white? There's something I have to tell you. (deep breath) Brian, the man you think your dad was and who he really was are two different things. Your dad was a top drawer police officer. But he was just as human as the rest of us, (a beat, quietly) He was having an affair with Jack Van Patton's wife. Brian REACTS, ready to throw Tanner off the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Being a good detective and all, Van Patton found out. He ambushed your father, not some criminal at large. A brother cop killed your dad. - Tanner squeezes Brian's shoulder. Let's him absorb that.”

dialogues.speaker: TANNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's why Van Patton stuck a shotgun in his mouth. It was a mess. But everyone did what they had to do to make it right. Nothing's black and white but the damn cars we drive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 160B
dialogues.text: 161 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian looks like he can't breathe. He grabs the rail for support. Blinks back tears.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Lou. What am I supposed to do now?

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Save your ass by cracking this damn case. Otherwise come Monday, they'11 rip you to pieces. Your first instinct was this Race.Wars thing. Follow your nose. Brian looks at Tanner. Grateful for the reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'll do what I gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's Nissan rockets across the bleak landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian holds the toy car Dominic gave him. Ahead a lonely intersection quarters the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A leathery OLD MAN, the only sign of life for miles sits a rock. He watches Brian's car pull up. Brian shows him the toy car. The Old Man points out the road leading to t mountains.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DESERT - DAY ” 161 Through a LONG LENS and dancing heat ripples we SEE a gathering. Vague, indefinite, then color and form impose themselves as we move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woodstock of underground racing. Held at an abandoned airport. Hundreds of amazing cars, hundreds of people. Ra THUMPS from dozens of speakers.

dialogues.speaker: TWO RUNWAYS
dialogues.text: Run drag races. Long lines of paired cars await their tur ENGINE NOISE rises and falls with each quick race. MUSIC BOOMS from a hundred stereos.

dialogues.speaker: FIND BRIAN'S 240SX
dialogues.text: Approaching a parking area-near a TENT CITY. Brian navigates through an eclectic crowd, everyone from gangbangers to Suburbanites. He's wary, watchful, looking for answers on the faces he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleachers have been set up along two runways. Old tires a hay bales for safety. DISPLAYS show their times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars awaiting their turn two by two. INSPECTORS in white lab coats check them out, soap numbers on windshields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, walking through the cars. He SEES Jesse's VW waiti in line to race. He crosses to Jesse and leans in his window. They tap fists.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Yo, Jesse. Where's everyone at? Jesse points. Now Brian SEES Dominic, his team, Mia, standing by their cars, which are parked in a staging are near the runway.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Wish me luck. Brian sees worry on Jesse's face.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What's up? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 165 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 73. CONTINUED: ‘ 164

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm racing for cars.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ain't this your dad's car? You can't bet what's not yours.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: ’ No, lookit, I'll win this fool's car, then me and my pops can roll together when he gets out of prison.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Not if they lock him back up after he kills you. Call it off, who you racing? Brian looks over Jesse's car at the racer he's paired wit Brian REACTS -- The other racer is Pete Tran, driving his Mustang. He glares at Brian, who glares right back.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You better win, man. An OFFICIAL with a.clipboard waves Jesse and Pete forward It's their turn to race. Brian watches Jesse pull up to t starting line. Jesse's having second thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time displays are reset to zero. A stoplight between the lanes glows red. The light turns yellow. The two drivers tense with anticipation. Jesse grabs the shifter. Pushes in the clutch, trades looks with Pete. The light turns green... VROOM! Tires spin as the VW and Mustang launch like missiles. Jesse's head is thrown back, he pulls ahead for an early lead. Then Pete closes the gap until they are dead even. They burn through the gears. Jesse gives Pete the finger and hits the nitrous. He shoo ahead several lengths. Pete isn't worried.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Too soon, my child. Pete eyes his gage cluster, the track ahead, calculating. Then hits the nitrous... (CONT INUED)

dialogues.speaker: 165A
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 74. CONTINUED: ‘ 165

dialogues.speaker: PETE'S MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Busts the finish first. Then Jesse by half a car length, with tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic shakes his head sadly at Jesse's loss. Then Mia a his team REACT.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Jesse keeps going--

dialogues.speaker: VINCE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Where's Jesse going? --right out the gate. Gaining speed, SMASHES through the outer fence and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Dominic's team trades surprised looks. Brian runs over an joins them, Mia happy to see him. Brian taps fists with Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Jesse raced Sneaky Pete for pinks.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Dammit. It's a problem he didn't need. He watches Pete pulls up a get out of his Mustang. And-is quickly joined on foot by Lance and a dozen surly Long Beach Viets.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: I won. That's my car now, where's he taking it?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: To the car wash or something. You'll get the car. We're not shysters. Just be cool. Pete looks at Dominic, scowls. His team menaces closer. Vince looks ready to chew Lance's head off. Leon, Letty even Mia, are ready to scrap. A crowd gathering.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Be cool? Cops were up in my house shaming me in front of my family because you dropped a dime on me. Cops were talking about you on the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 . 75. 16SA CONTINUED: ‘ 165A Dominic REACTS. And despite himself, Brian too.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I never dropped a dime on no one. I'm not down with the Man. Pete points at Brian accusingly. PETE . Bullshit. Your blue eyed butt boy is the Man. The team out there jacking trucks, I bet it's your team. Don't even think you're putting your sins on me. I'm sick of you messing with my team. It's stopping. Now. --CRACK! Dominic nails Pete on the tip of his jaw. Pete throws a combo, landing one on Dominic's forehead. Now Dominic really goes nuts, savaging Pete with a vicious series of blows. Vince and Lance punch each other. Pete's Crew surges forward-- -~Brian swings at two Vietnamese who rush him. Letty stan her ground, throwing solid punches. As does Leon. Mia clotheslines a Vietnamese guy running at Dominic with a screwdriver. He goes down on his back, the screwdriver is suddenly seized from his hand as several sequoia-sized SAMOAN SECURITY GUARDS wade into the fracas, separating t - combatants.

dialogues.speaker: SAMOAN GUARD
dialogues.text: Get back! Y'all ain't squabblin' here. The teams trade hard stares as they part. Pete, his eyebr split and bleeding, wipes blood from his face and flicks at Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: This isn't over. Dominic tries to charge Pete, but is restrajned.

dialogues.speaker: SAMOAN GUARD
dialogues.text: Sorry, Toretto, keeping the peace is all. Harmony, bro. Dominic understands, they tap fists. Dominic and his team head back to their tents. Letty sucks on a split knuckle. Dominic looks at Brian, angry and suspicious. Vince looking at Brian, walking with Mia. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 168B
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 76. CONTINUED: (2) ‘ 165A

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: He's a nutcase. There's no way you're a cop. Brian grabs her waist reassuringly. Dominic waves Vince over and whispers to him as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, ABANDONED RUNWAY
dialogues.text: It's time to dance. A full on rave is in effect. A thousand plus bodies undulate to a techno throb. Strobes flicker. Lights pulse. Dancers wave lightsticks and glow in the dark staffs and hoops. A Dd works the 1's and 2's from atop a tall tower of scaffolding aglow with a thousand lightsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian exits a port-a-potti, hitching up his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is surprised to arrive to find no one about. He begins searching the bags and equipment. His experienced hands work quickly. Then he finds it -- A speargun tip. Brian stares at the damning evidence in his hand. He sags visibly as he realizes Dominic's team are the hijackers. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian moves through the cars, then stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Dominic have a heated argument. Letty and Leon si in Letty's Eclipse. Vince waits in Dominic's RX7. Mia clearly doesn't want Dominic to leave. She grabs his arm He jerks away, gets in his car.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE,
dialogues.text: Brian watches them go, the wheels of revelation turn. Bri feels chopped off at the knees. Dominic is the crook he i after. Brian takes a beat to compose himself, runs back t the tent city.  169 174 175 176 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 77.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 174
dialogues.text: EXT. TORETTO CAMP - NIGHT — 175, Brian waiting for Mia, all smiles, like nothing is wrong. She arrives.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Where's everyone at?

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: They're meeting us by the DJ's tower. C'mon. Mia runs off toward the rave. Brian follows with urgency, hurt by her lie.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Mia, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia plunges into the crowd, Brian follows her deeper and deeper into the writhing mass of limbs. She teases him, playing hide and seek in the humanity. Trance dancers in various altered states jostle Brian. He plows his way through entranced bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian loses sight of Mia. Searching through the crowd. More and more frantic.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian has lost her. He stands there, looking around, the only static figure in a sea of colorful motion. A tap on his shoulder. He turns. It's Mia. Dancing, sexy, smiling. Brian grabs her shoulders and stills her.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Every badge in the Southland warits to blow your brother out of his boots. This is your chance to save his life.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Revision 05/05/2000 78.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm a cop. I'm investigating the hijackings. I'm from Simi Valley, not Arizona, Mia REACTS. Fights away from his grip. She punches him hard in the.stomach.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: You asshole. You lied to me, Brian. Oh, God. Is that even your name? What's your real name?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Brian O'Conner. They suggested I use my real first name to be more natural. Mia can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: That's so wrong. You played me like a piano. You don't do that to people.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: My feelings are real, Mia.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: ; Mine were too, They were. But you lied to me. Brian and Mia look at each other as their hearts break.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, I lied. But unless you help Dominic, you're gonna be standing by a hole in the ground with him in it. Help me save him. A beat. Mia grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Let's go. cut To: 177 EXT. ABANDONED GAS STATION - NIGHT ° 177 A lonely, tired old building in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four cars parked under tarps. Three tarps are pulled off reveal the stealth black Civics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 177B
dialogues.text: 178 179 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 79. CONTINUED: ‘ 177A To reveal Leon, Letty, Dominic and Vince.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Don't like doing this without Jesse. Vince screws a tip onto a speargun.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: This is sketchy with all the heat.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: It's perfect. Two thousand people saw us tonight. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE on a motorcycle watches the abandoned gas statio with binoculars. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three cars gaining speed. PUSH IN ON:

dialogues.speaker: THE LEAD CAR
dialogues.text: Right through its darkened windshield--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Dominic drives, Next to him is Vince, both wear earpieces. The mood serious, professional.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: We're a car short so Letty, you got right side. Leon, keep on the scanners, Man wants us bad. We cool?

dialogues.speaker: ON LETTY
dialogues.text: Her gameface on. Tightening her four point harness.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: ON LEON
dialogues.text: He adjust the police scanners in the dash.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH DOMINIC
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You cool, Vee? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: I'm cool. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian doing 120MPH. Mia has a map on her knees.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Civics are stashed here outside Thermal. Brian looks over at the map.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: They wouldn't double back. And the ten is too well patrolled. Shit, that leaves...

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: All this. Mia's finger points to an area where four highways come together. Brian grabs his cell and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner fast asleep with his WIFE. The phone RINGS. He answers groggily.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: It's me. I got a tasker. Call Pac Bell security and get a cell trace going on Toretto's phone.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: I'm on it. Making headway?

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Bigtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLICK. Brian hangs up. He and Mia trade a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tandem Big Rig, king of the road, plies the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER is a lean mean former Marine, a plug of tobacc in his cheek, Neil Young on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: Blind him. He grabs a chopped shotgun off the seat next t him. KERCHACK! Loads a live one. This big boy's playing for keeps. A pick-up passes him. Keeps going. The Driver relaxes a notch, puts down the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's cell rings.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: TANNER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Northbound 86. Mile one fourteen outside Coachella. Watch your six, Lone Ranger.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Everyday. Brian hangs up. Mia looking at the map. Points straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: We're good. Exit's four miles that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three black Civics zoom closer to their target, lights of

dialogues.speaker: UP THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Is the Tandem Rig.  186 187 189 190 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 82, INT.» DOMINIC'S CIVIC (MOVING) - NIGHT 186 Vince puts on a gas mask. Dominic pulls closer to the Tandem Rig.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Big honker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Civics take position on either side of the Tandem Rig They hit their HEADLIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver REACTS. SEES the Civics on either side. Dominic's Civic pulls in front. Vince stands up through t sunroof in a gasmask, aiming the speargun.

dialogues.speaker: THWACK
dialogues.text: The anchor pierces the windshield. The Civic guns it and the windshield is torn from its frame. The Driver lays a hand on the shotgun and grins. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince reloads the speargun. Aims. Fires...

dialogues.speaker: THWACK
dialogues.text: The spear embeds itself into the seat by the Driver. Vince stands atop Dominic's Civic. An insane surfer. He activates the winch on his chest and leaps-~ ~-The winch pulls him to the Tandem Rig. WHAM! Vince hits the grill. He grabs the bulldog hood ornament, pulls a chemical grenade from his pocket and pu the pin and tries to pull himself onto the hood. Dominic pulls far ahead to recon the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TANDEM RIG
dialogues.text: The Driver SEES Vince's head pop up. He aims through the open windshield-~ BOOM! He fires -- Shredding the hood by Vince's head. Vince drops the smoking grenade. It skitters across the highway, HISSING smoke. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KERCHACK! The Driver shucks in a fresh shell and aims at Vince's hand gripping the Mack bulldog. BOOM! Nine SCREAMING buckshot pellets-- --Gouge the hood, and Vince's hand, shredding his glove.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, TANDEM RIG, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Vince lets go. BANGS against the grill, hanging by the steel cable attached to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: I'm hit. Guy's got a boomer. Shoot this fucker,

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: (filtered) No way. That thing jackknifes, you're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Get me off'a here, now! Dominic's Civic instantly drops back, ready to help...

dialogues.speaker: A HOWLING WHINE 192
dialogues.text: Three HURRICANE MOTORCYCLES appear like demons.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: On the lead bike. He pulls the Mac~11 from his jacket. Behind him is--

dialogues.speaker: LANCE
dialogues.text: Who opens the throttle wide on his bike and pulls ahead o Pete. An overpass, its CONCRETE COLUMNS just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Boss, we got bad company. Pete zips alongside Dominic, who's Civic is.ebumper to bu with the Tandem Rig.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TANDEM RIG 194
dialogues.text: Fearing Pete's Mac, the Driver lays down on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Aims the Mac at Dominic. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: You're going down for this shit, not me. BRRDDDDDDT! He shoots Dominic's front tire. Rubber shreds off. The magnesium rims GRIND on the asphalt, trailing sparks. The Rig is swinging back and forth. The two trailers oscillate back and forth in ever increasing arcs.

dialogues.speaker: ON LETTY
dialogues.text: She sees Lance getting in position to shoot out her tire.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Oh, no you ain't... Letty stomps the BRAKE, whips the wheel. Her car spins.

dialogues.speaker: LANCE IS
dialogues.text: Suddenly staring at the side of Letty's Civic. Too late to correct. WHAM! He hits and ricochets into--

dialogues.speaker: A CONCRETE COLUMN
dialogues.text: SPLAT! His bike EXPLODES. And that's the end of Lance.

dialogues.speaker: LETTY'S CIVIC 195
dialogues.text: Spinning, WHACKS a concrete column. Shearing off the back The wreckage comes to rest and an unscathed Letty thanks rollcage.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You okay Smurfette?

dialogues.speaker: LETTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Get her.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN . 197
dialogues.text: Looks back at the roiling fireball consuming his friend.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Lance, no! He pulls a fresh mag from his jacket. Now he's going to kill Dominic.  198 199 200 201 202 203 - Blue Revision 05/05/2000 85.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE 198
dialogues.text: Unstraps the cable reel from his chest, wraps a turn of cable around his forearm and leans out forward fromthe grill. So he can leap onto the roof of:

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC'S CIVIC 199
dialogues.text: Swinging back and forth in time with the swerving Rig. No easy with a drive wheel running on the rim.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN 200
dialogues.text: Appears alongside Dominic. Dominic knows it's for keeps this time. He jerks the whee ducks, swerving away. Just as-~ Vince jumps. And Pete opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: BRRRRDDDDDDDT
dialogues.text: Rounds pepper Dominic's car, the hood, the delicate engin Vince falls under the rig's massive bumper. Being dragged by the cable on his arms.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN 201
dialogues.text: And the remaining Hurricanes are far, far up the road mak a speedy getaway.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE 202
dialogues.text: Is a tough costumer, he pulls himself out from under the truck. Now halfway up the grill.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I'm okay. He's happily back on the grill.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC'S CAR 203
dialogues.text: Is dying. The engine HOWLS as it chews itself to scrap. THOOMP! A small explosion under the hood. And the engine quits.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: That's all she's got. I need a ride. Leon, with Letty already on board, SEES Dominic's disable Civic up a ahead rolling to a stop up a ahead. SCREECH! H slams on the brakes to pick up Dominic.  204 205 206 207 208 209 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 86.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAB 204
dialogues.text: The anchor pulls free from the seat, flies out the window

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Falls under the cab.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANCHOR 206
dialogues.text: Catches on the Bulldog hood ornament.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE RIG'S CAB 207
dialogues.text: Vince is buffeted violently against the tires. The cable tears into his flesh of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Mia drive past Lance's burning Hurricane and Letty's demolished Civic.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: It went bad.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Real bad. Next they pass Dominic's smoking and shot-up Civic.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two down.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Ahead is Leon's Civic, and it's catching up to the Tandem Rig -- That is dragging Vince underneath.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: It's vince!

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN FLOORS IT, PASSING THE CIVIC. 209
dialogues.text: Brian guides his car alongside the trailer where Vince is dragging.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Drive! Mia climbs onto Brian's lap. Their limbs tangling and untangling as Brian gives her the controls.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: I got it! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian opens the sunroof. Stands up, buffeted by wind.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Closer! Closer! Mia guides the car right alongside the trailer. She works the wheel, expertly following the back and forth swing. Brian leans way out of the sunroof. Hanging over the side of the car, his legs bracing him. He REACTS to the paveme zooming past his face. He extends his arms, reaching for Vince.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOOD ORNAMENT 210
dialogues.text: Tears out. Cable WHIPPING--

dialogues.speaker: VINCE 211
dialogues.text: About to slide under large dual wheels-- Brian grabs Vince's belt with both hands. He pulls him in a bearhug.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Got him! Stop! Stop! Mia whips the car away from the Tandem Rig. EEEEEEEEEE! Stomps the brakes, the car swerving violently, Brian's ar tight around Vince's torso. The Tandem Rig goes on its way. The 240SX stops on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian gently lays Vince on the street. Kneels over him. Vince is pretty torn up. The cable has mutilated his righ forearm. He has bad road rashes. The black Civic comes to stop near them and Dominic is out like a shot. Brian does first aid assessment, all business.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: You know what you're doing? °

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Gimme your belt. Dominic yanks off his belt. Hands it to Brian. Who tourniquets Vince's arm just below the armpit. Brian straddles Vince and does heart thrusts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 212 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 88. CONTINUED: ‘ 212 Dominic gets ready to blow air in Vince's lungs. Brian ca see he has had training.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Vee, I'm kicking your ass if you die. They. administer CPR for a long beat. Mia gets out of the car and watches Brian, struck by how earnest he is. | After a set of chest thrusts, Brian checks for a pulse. T his great relief, he finds one.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: He's back.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: He's breathing, Dominic's relief is clear. He looks at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: , BRIAN
dialogues.text: Someone doesn't start a couple full bore IVs, he's dead in ten minutes. Brian flips open his cell.

dialogues.speaker: CHP OFFICER VOICE
dialogues.text: Highway Patrol. State your emergency.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: (into phone) This is Officer Brian O'Conner. I'm off duty LAPD. I need a lifeflight rollout. My twenty's the 86 Highway at mile marker fifty six. One trauma victim. Twenty two years old. Six foot. One eighty. He's in shock, bleeding out and in cardiac arrest.

dialogues.speaker: CHP OFFICER VOICE
dialogues.text: Okay buddy, I'm putting them in the air, Gimme your badge real quick.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: One nine six zero four. « Dominic looking at Brian, overwhelmed with betrayal. Bria feels just as betrayed, his jaw muscles rippling as he clenches his teeth. Then Vince begins shaking violently. Brian and Dominic give him their full attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STAR on the horizon is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotlights zoom across the desert. Then onto the freeway. Then onto the black Civic, Brian's 240SX and a cluster of people below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian covers Vince with his body as debris swirl in the powerful chopper's rotorwash. it is a maelstrom of light and noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter hovers over the freeway and lands. Instant two PARAMEDICS pop out and run TOWARDS CAMERA with aid pa and a trauma board. The Paramedics strap Vince to the board. Brian helps carr him to the waiting chopper.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Move! Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is loaded into the back of the air ambulance. Brian and Mia pile in.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Get in! Get in! Brian looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black Civic with Dominic, Leon and Letty inside is hightailing it out of there.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian isn't surprised, he expected as much.e CREW CHIEF slams the door, gives a thumbs up and the pilo twists the throttle. The desert drops away. Mia looks at Brian, who is watching the Paramedics start on Vince and prep bags of blood expander. Brian feels Mia gaze and turns te look at her. Mia squeezes his hand. cuT TO:  216 217 218 219 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Mia somber. Doing a hundred on the 10 East. Heading back into L.A. The spires of downtown are amber towers of flame as the sun gives them its morning kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big bad black Buick Regal is parked on the lawn. The front door is open, Brian's 240SX pulls to a stop and Bri and Mia get out. They look at the Buick.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: What are you going to do to him? Brian gives her a look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic exiting the front door with a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Instinctively draws his gun. Draws a bead on Dominic.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Drop it Toretto! No more running! Dominic stops. Lowers the shotgun to his side.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I didn't run from you. I had to find Jesse. Pete Tran's got him. I knew this shit would happen. You gonna shoot me, cop? Dominic is desperate, anxious. Brian lowers his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Lance Nguyen's dead. Vince lost his arm. Least he's stable. Enough is enough. Tell me where Jesse is. I'll get a SWAT unit in there. We'll handle it.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Want his blood on your hands? You know Pete's a twisted freak. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He hears a siren or sees any more SWAT ninjas, he's blowing Jesse's head off. He's a kid, man. He's like family.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? Lose your head too? You know what kind of firepower they got. A beat as Dominic looks at Brian in anguish.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I gotta do something, Brian. I'm all he's got. Brian bites his lip, thinks a beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: No you're not. Let's go. Dominic is relieved. He gets in the Buick and its massive engine ROARS to life. Brian, gets back in his car, gives Mia a worried look. Both cars depart with haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In San Pedro near the Los Angeles Harbor facilities. Dominic's Buick pulls behind a warehouse. Brian's 240SX stops alongside it.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Don't let him get himself killed. Brian looks at Mia.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I won't. Brian and Dominic exit their cars at the same time, weapo ready. They trade a look -- They're in this together. Mia getting out of Brian's car.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN/DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Stay in the car. She does, very reluctantly. Dominic points the way. He and Brian cross to some dumpsters. Checking weapons. Dominic fumbles with the shotgun's action. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 222 223 224 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 92. CONTINUED: ‘ 221

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Gimme the shotgun. (off Dominic's look) I shoot like you drive. Dominic gives him the shotgun. Brian hands him his Glock. They crouch behind the dumpsters, eyeing a warehouse. It looks like no one is here this quiet Sunday morning.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: The guy who moves my shit, that's where he keeps everything.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Ted Henderson. Dominic shoots Brian a look.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Guess you only look dumb. Brian is observing the area with his trained eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big sliding door is open about 2 feet. Brian and Domini approach the open door. It feels like a trap.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Let's run for it. They back up for a good running start. And run as fast as they can for the intimidating opening--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight pours into the dark warehouse from the partly op door. Brian charges inside, then Dominic. Brian dives behind a row of pallets. Followed by Dominic. They lay flat on the concrete floor, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get a look at this place. It's full of the latest stuf everyone wants. Motorcycles. Big Screen TVs. Luxury cars and parts. VCRs and DVD players. Brian and Dominic take i the panorama before them. Not a soul in sight, except for

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Bound and gagged. Eyes brimming with agony and dread. Because he is chained to the undercarriage of: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 224 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 93.

dialogues.speaker: A CHEVY SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Hanging from a gantry crane. It is slowly being lowered t the cement floor. 20 feet to go. With its wheels removed, Jesse will be squashed like a bug. He thrashes madly. SCREAMS into the duct tape on his face.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC AND BRIAN
dialogues.text: Trade incensed looks. Dominic points at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mounted to the far wall of the warehouse. A perilously exposed stretch of open floor leads to it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Wherever Pete is, assume he's covering those controls. Dominic doesn't care. He goes for it, up and running befo Brian can stop him.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dominic, no! Dominic running across no man's land.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN APPEARS
dialogues.text: Ducking out from between a row of stolen BMWs. He levels the Mac~-11 at Dominic with a sadistic grin-- KERCHACK! Brian shucks in a fresh one. Shoulders the big gun-- BRDDDDDT! Pete opens fire, his Mac firehoses lead-- Bullets tear into Big Screen TV's and motorcycles as they chase after a running Dominic. He dives between two Hurricanes.

dialogues.speaker: BOO-YEAH
dialogues.text: Brian fires. Taking out a Beemer windshield.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Is hit, he jerks backwards. Disappearing between the Beemers.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Still several yards from the crane controls. Trapped. BAM BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM~BAM! He fires Brian's pistol uselessly at the shadows. CLICK -- It's empty. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 224 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 94,

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Stares at the cement floor a couple feet from his face.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Runs out in the open, cycles the pumpgun -- KERCHACK! Sprints towards Pete's position. He hits the ground, rolls...

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Slaps home a fresh magazine. He lays on his belly, to sho under the cars at Brian. The Mac CLICKING against the cement.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Heard that, fires at the noise--

dialogues.speaker: BOO-YEAH
dialogues.text: Buckshot SIZZLES under the cars. A ricochet ZINGS into Pete's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Is up and running, towards the cars.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: SEES Brian's feet running toward him.

dialogues.speaker: BRRDDDDDDDDT
dialogues.text: Strafes Brian's legs. Who zigs as he runs. Bullets chasin his feet. Brian jumps onto a huge TV. Bullets chew up its base, where Brian's feet would have been.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: SEES a motorcycle helmet.. He SEES the Suburban is maybe feet off the floor. Time to act. He grabs the helmet, stands and runs toward the Suburban, helmet under his arm like a football. Aiming the empty gun in Pete's direction

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: It's me Pete! Want me? Get me! C'mon, Pete!

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Pops up like a demonic piece of toast. Aiming at Dominic-  © 225 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 95.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN 225
dialogues.text: Runs for the controls.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Dives for the Suburban... Tosses' the helmet under the ax

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Opens fire -- BRDDDDDDDDDT! Bullets shred the Suburban.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Slaps the emergency STOP button. The motorcycle under the helmet CRACKS IN TWO...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE'S NOSE
dialogues.text: Touches cement.

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Whirls on Brian... PETE'S FINGER -- Tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: One hand on the stop button, the other gripping the shotg takes a one handed shot--

dialogues.speaker: PETE TRAN
dialogues.text: Jerks out of sight behind the cars as buckshot splits his chest open.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: It appears to be solidly resting on the floor. On Jesse. Brian works the controls and the Suburban is suddenly lif several feet from the floor. Dominic crosses to Jesse. His head hangs limp. Then his eyes open and he begins thrashing. Very much alive. Dominic grins from ear to ear. Brian leaps onto the hood of a Beemer. SEES Pete sprawled behind it. He jumps down and kicks the Mac out of the way Pete is no threat. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door. Dominic walks out, silhouetted by daylight.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. TED'S WAREHOUSE — DAY 226 Brian’walks Jesse outside, an arm around his waist. Mia comes running. Brian hands him off to her.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: He's okay. Call nine one one. Brian looks for Dominic. Hears a massive ENGINE STARTING.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Just let hiim go.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: I can't. Brian takes off running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic's Buick disappears around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Brian hops in his Nissan, starts it and follows. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian burns up the road. Dominic nowhere in sight. Brian' cell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Turn right on Harper.

CLICK. Brian SEES Harper street. Makes a sharp right. Then stomps his brakes -- EEEEEEEEBEEEEE! Because Dominic is right there. Stopped at a red light. Brian's Nissan stops several yards behind him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian squints though his window at the Buick. Dominic extends an arm out and waves Brian forward. A beat. Then Brian puts it in first and pulls up to the Buick-- EXT. INTERSECTION — DAY 230 --stopping nose to nose above white crosswalk line. The cars, now side by side, RUMBLE with power. Dominic and Brian look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: We used to drag here when in high school. Streets're laid out all precise. That light up there...

dialogues.speaker: UP THE SIDESTREET
dialogues.text: Is another RED STOPLIGHT. At a RAILROAD CROSSING.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is exactly one quarter mile from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the left, a good distance away is a FREIGHT TRAIN, mov at a good clip.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: When that light turns green, I'm going for it. I'm beating that train.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Just gonna drive away from everything?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: All I see here is you, (a beat) I only lost one race in my life. My first. My old man beat me bloody that night. Never lost a race since. Swear to God. Brian looks at Dominic, these two are way beyond bullshitting each other.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: My dad was a cop. I knew from the day I was born I was gonna be one too. Because he told me so. They trade understanding locks. It's all kind of funny, b it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: THAT DAMN TRAIN
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Is getting closer. Dominic settles in his seat, because..

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER LIGHT
dialogues.text: Is turning yellow.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You go, I go. Brian frantically sets his turbo and NOS controllers. Dominic is cool as a cucumber.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: What are we racing for?

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Freedom. Brian gives him a nod. Then two hands grab shifters -- 1s gear. Two feet on clutch pedals.

dialogues.speaker: TWO PAIRS OF EYES
dialogues.text: Watching, waiting for...

dialogues.speaker: A GREEN LIGHT
dialogues.text: VROOM! The Buick is a monster, its left front wheel rises two feet off the ground as engine torque twists its chass

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO CARS
dialogues.text: Lunge forward. Suddenly that train looks closer than ever

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GEAR
dialogues.text: Dominic pulls ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car rockets forward. Brian ignores the gages and LISTENS to the engine. Time seems to slow as Brian finall finds that special zone... His face reflects a serenity we haven't seen before. It seems like forever as he clutches and shifts into thir Just as perfect as can be. He can almost hear each individual GEAR in the transmission. The car is SPEAKING him as none have before.  232 233 234 235 Blue Revision 05/05/2000 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominic can FEEL Brian right behind. Dominic is in the zo too as he slips the Buick into FOURTH GEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scary place to be right now because a huge train and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --two fast cars are approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGINEER REACTS. Because he's about to nail two cars. He curses their stupidity as he hits the AIRHORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian focuses on getting every last foot pound of torque from his engine. Computer, car and driver have become a trinity of acceleration. The train is so close Brian can feel the RUMBLE of its diesels in his bones.

dialogues.speaker: THE INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: A lot of fast moving metal is coming together and it look real bad...

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO CARS
dialogues.text: Are dead even. Dominic pulls ahead. Then Brian. Then Dominic again. Now over a hundred MPH.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: HONKING its airhorn. Nothing can stop it.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN AND DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Make eye contact. And within the molasses of time that th both occupy now, Dominic says goodbye. AND SLAMS IT IN STH .

dialogues.speaker: THE BUICK
dialogues.text: Pulls ahead with sudden and surprising acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: Realizes he can never beat Dominic. Either he can hit the brakes or... (CONTINUED)
